div.p: With reference to our Employment offer letter, we are please to appoint you in our organization on the following terms and conditions:
1. POSITION

You will be offered the position of in the Company. While serving the Company in that position, you will report to, and receive direction from the Manager or as may be communicated to you from time to time.
2. DATE OF JOINING
Your employment shall commence from the date you report for duty which shall be not later than .
3. ANNUAL COMPENSATION

You shall be paid an annual gross, all-inclusive compensation of Rs.() per annum. The compensation will be subject to applicable taxes and will be paid to you after deduction of income tax and other applicable taxes at source. The compensation will be paid to you monthly in arrears. It is a condition of your service that you shall abide by the Companyâ€™s policy maintaining the strictest confidentiality of the compensation you receive from the Company.
4. PROBATION

You will be on probation for a period of 3 months from the date of commencement of your services with the Company, which period may be extended for further period(s) at the discretion of the Company. On successful completion of the probationary period and that if your performance is found satisfactory, the Company may confirm your services in the Company by issue of a letter to that effect.

During the probation period, either the company or you may terminate your employment by giving one month's notice to the other party. The Company reserves the right to terminate your employment by giving compensation equivalent to one month's gross remuneration, in lieu of the notice period.
5. SALARY STRUCTURE
The Company reserves the right to alter the salary or its structure at any time depending on external and internal environment.
6. STATUTORY DEDUCTIONS

The Company shall make necessary statutory deductions from your gross salary and directly pay on your behalf to the authorities concerned. In instances where the Company is not under an obligation to make these deductions, you agree to make such payments to the authorities concerned keeping the Company informed.
7. INCREMENTS AND ADVANCEMENTS
Your growth and increase in salary will depend solely on your performance and contribution to the Company.
8. TRANSFER
You can be transferred to any of our units situated anywhere in India or abroad. At such time, compensation applicable to the specific location will be payable to you.

t.p: 9. MEDICAL COVERAGE

We are expecting you to get comprehensive medical insurance coverage for self and family per your convenience and with Company contracted insurance company. Medical policy and expenses would be the component in the gross salary itself. You will be insured of Sum of Rs - 500000/-GSM, and accidental insurance.
10. CONFLICT OF INTEREST

Your position with the Company calls for whole time employment and you will devote yourself exclusively to the business of the Company. You will not take up any other work for remuneration (part time or otherwise) or work in advisory capacity or be interested directly or indirectly (except as a share/debenture holder) in any other trade or business during your employment with the Company, without written permission from the Company.
11. CODE OF CONDUCT
The Company expects the highest standard of ethical conduct from its employees. You will work honestly, faithfully and diligently for the growth of the Company.
12. WORKING HOURS

Your standard working hours will be 9:30am to 6pm, Monday through Friday. In view of your position in the Company, you shall effectively perform to ensure results and you will be expected to work beyond the standard working hours to achieve the results, whenever your job so requires. Additionally, as mentioned in your interview process, the Company may implement staggered work shift, from time to time. In such as event, you shall abide by the change in the standard working hours as may be notified by the Company to accommodate such staggered shifts.
13. SECRECY AND CONFIDENTIALITY

You are expected to maintain utmost secrecy in regard to the affairs of the Company and shall keep confidential, any information that may come to your professional knowledge as an employee of the company. In addition, whether in the employment of the Company or not, you will agree to keep confidential and not use for purposes commercial or non-commercial any Company-specific information in general and information relating to the following in particular:

ul.li: Customers
Prospects
Suppliers
Employees
Investors
Business Partners
Technology Alliances
Methodologies and Intellectual Property (IP) of the Company

t.p:
You shall execute / sign such other non-disclosure agreements as and when required by the Company or the Client or any other Business Partner as the situation may warrant, general covenant against disclosure, covenants not to compete, and covenants for non-solicitation. You must return to the Company, upon request, and in any event, upon termination of your employment, all documents and tangible items which belong to the Company or which refer to any confidential information and which are in your possession or under your control. You are expected to comply with all Information Security policies and procedures as laid down from time to time. Without prejudice to other requirements of non-disclosure, the Company reserves the right to advise you from time to time on specific information, including terms of your employment contract with the Company, that you may not disclose to specified parties.
You agree to comply with such advice. In the event of your resigning from the services of INSTELLARS Global Consulting Pvt Ltd. you shall not reveal your decision to anyone connected with INSTELLARS Global Consulting Pvt Ltd. in a business context -whether customer, prospect, business partner or any other constituency - until the Company grants you express permission to divulge your resignation.
14. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS

All intellectual property rights including but not limited to Patents, Copyrights, Trademarks, Designs, Methodologies, Technical Papers wherever they might be published, and White Papers developed by you during your employment with the Company shall be the sole and exclusive property of the Company. Where ownership rights to such property cannot be transferred under applicable law, any exploitation rights thereto, shall be transferred to the Company in accordance with the applicable law.
15. LEAVE

You will be entitled to a total of 30 days for each completed year of service, in accordance with the leave policy of the Company. The Company reserves right to alter the policy from time to time and the Policy in effect for the time being shall be applicable to you.
16. PROVIDENT FUND, GRATUITY AND OTHER RETIREMENT BENEFIT PLANS

You will participate in the Company Provident Fund, Gratuity and other Retirement Plans, as per the rules and regulations of such plans, as may be applicable to employees at your level in the Company.
17. ABANDONMENT OF SERVICE

You acknowledge and agree that your service and your assignment are crucial to the Company and its clients and any abandonment by you of your services under this agreement during the assignment will cause substantial and potentially irreparable damage and injury to the Company, to clients and/or Business Partners. You therefore understand and agree that if you abandon or terminate your services during your assignment under this agreement before the assignment is completed, such action will constitute a breach of this agreement and that the Company will pursue all available and appropriate legal, equitable and injunctive remedies against you in court for such damages and injury after pursuing the settlement procedure described in Clause 16 if such procedure cannot be completed successfully.
18. NOTICE AND TERMINATION

You will be required to give two month's notice or salary thereof in case you decide to leave our services, subject to the Company's discretion. The Company, at its choice, will either relieve you at the end of the one month notice period or will relieve you from your employment by giving one month's notice or salary thereof. The Company may terminate your services, without assigning any reasons, with a notice period to you of one month or salary thereof. No Leaves can be taken in Notice period. If any leave taken Notice period will get extended.
The Company is an "at will" employer and nothing contained herein or in any other agreement shall alter the "at will" employment relationship that exists between the Company and you. However, for misconduct, misbehavior or non-performance, the Company may terminate your services with immediate notice.
19. FULL AND FINAL SETTLEMENT

Full and Final settlement will be done after 45 days from the date of Reliving, which will be after completion of 2 months of Notice period.
Major Components that are part of Full & Final Settlement Process

ul.li: Unpaid Salary (1st month salary of NP will be paid in next payroll month) and last month in F&F.
Non Availed Leave and Bonus
Gratuity:-As per the Act 1972 Gratuity will be offered within 30 days of the separation or else it will have to be paid with interest if four years and 240 days have been completed by the employee.
Deduction: - TDS, Income Tax, PF, Compensation for Notice Period not served, any advance.

t.p: 20. PAST RECORD

If any information or declaration given by you to the Company proves to be false or if you are found to have willfully suppressed any material information, you will be liable to be discharged from the services of the Company, without any notice or compensation.
21. NON-SOLICITATION

On termination of employment with the Company, you shall not seek business, directly, through your new employer or indirectly, from the Company's customers, suppliers, partners and prospects for a period of twelve (12) months from the cessation of your employment.
22. RULES AND REGULATIONS

All the terms and conditions in this offer are based on the Company's policies applicable currently. For all service regulations and matters, not explicitly covered in this offer, such as Code of Conduct, Travel, Leave, etc., you will be governed by the Company's policies and rules applicable at the relevant time. The Company's policies, including the terms contained herein, may be changed by the Company from time to time to reflect the changing needs of the business. Violation of the Company's policies and rules can lead to the termination of your employment without notice.
23. DUAL EMPLOYMENT

You will be in the exclusive employment of the Company. You will not be entitled to accept directly or indirectly any part time or fulltime job or transact any business of any kind whatsoever during the course of the employment with the Company.
24. SETTLEMENT OF DISPUTES

While in the service of the Company, you may be deputed anywhere in the world for the discharge of your duties. Regardless of your location of work, any dispute arising out of your employment with the Company will be settled in the following manner. In the event of any dispute arising under or by virtue of this agreement or any difference of opinion between the parties concerning their rights and obligations under this agreement, the Parties shall use their best efforts to resolve such dispute or difference amicably by discussion and mutual accord. If the dispute cannot be resolved in this manner within fifteen (15) days, the Parties shall arrange a meeting between appropriate representatives designated by each Party, who shall have an additional fifteen (15) days to resolve the dispute or difference. If the dispute or difference is not settled within the thirty (30) days period, then, unless the Parties otherwise agree in writing, either Party may serve written notice on the other Party stating its intention to proceed to arbitration. The unresolved claim, dispute or difference shall be finally settled by arbitration under the Arbitration Act, 1996.The Company will appoint the sole Arbitrator and will conduct the Arbitration in accordance with its rules for conduct of Arbitration proceedings then in force. Such arbitration shall be the sole and exclusive remedy between the Parties with respect to such dispute. In the event of any claim, dispute or difference being referred to arbitration, this Contract will continue to be enforced. The arbitration shall take place in Bangalore, Karnataka. The arbitration award shall be final and binding on each Party. The expenses incurred by the parties to participate in the arbitration are to the respective parties' accounts
25. POST EMPLOYMENT VERIFICATION

Your employment will be subject to a background check, which will be conducted by such agency/fir/ establishment, whose services are contracted by the Company, from time to time. The verification will include authentication of any factual or historical information provided by you, related to past and present data such as reference details, previous employment details, educational credentials and criminal records etc. You are required to give your consent, by signing the Declaration attached.
26. INDEMNIFICATION

You shall indemnify, defend and hold the Company, its officers, directors, associates and agents, harmless from any and all claims, causes of action, damages, obligations or liabilities of any kind or nature arising out of or connected with any act or omission of yourself during the course of the employment with the Company and thereafter.
27. LIMITATION

Any claim by you against the Company arising out of your employment / termination / separation of employment shall be made in writing and served upon the Company. within two (2) months from the date of your leaving the Company. Any claim made by you beyond two months shall be waived by you and shall not affect or bind the Company with respect to such claim.

28. OTHERS
The waiver by either party of a breach of any provision of this agreement by the other party shall not operate or be construed as a waiver of any subsequent breach.
If any provision of this agreement shall be declared to be illegal or unenforceable for any reason, the remaining provisions of this agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
You acknowledge that you are not subject to any contractual or legal restriction with any prior employer that prevents you from accepting this position..
This job offer contains the entire agreement and understanding between you and the Company with respect to the terms and conditions of your employment.No other promises, agreements or understandings, written or oral, not stated herein shall be binding unless it is in writing and signed by you and an authorized representative of the Company.
Please acknowledge your acceptance of these terms and conditions of employment by signing the duplicate copy of this letter and returning the same to us for the Companyâ€™s records.
Thanking You.
